entry.title: How to deploy Fiori to SAP S/4Hana Public Cloud using VS Code
entry.content: I have requirement to deploy fiori UI5 to S/4Hana Public Cloud but i don't have acces to BTP and BAS, can i still do it using VS Code? is there any documentation about that

entry.title: How to show CGST, SGST and IGST separately in Adobe Form (SDBIL_CI_STANDARD_IN) in SAP S/4HANA Publi
entry.content:
Dear SAP Experts,

We are working in SAP S/4HANA Cloud (Public Edition, 3-System Landscape) and using the standard billing form SDBIL_CI_STANDARD_IN.

Currently, in the billing document PDF we are getting only the cumulative GST value. The business requirement is to show CGST, SGST, and IGST separately in the Adobe form.
       

  • How can we extend the standard form to bring in CGST, SGST, and IGST values?

  • Is there any standard way to fetch these fields or do we need backend logic to split cumulative GST into CGST/SGST/IGST?

  • Are there any blogs, KBAs, or SAP Help documents that explain how to extend SDBIL_CI_STANDARD_IN for India GST scenarios?

      If anyone has already implemented this, please suggest the correct approach or point me to a reference blog/document.

Thanks in advance,
Sanjay

entry.title: S/4HANA Public Cloud RF Application customization using screen personas with custom UI
entry.content:
Hi Everyone,

in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud, I have a requirement in RF Application /SCWM/RF_UI, to add custom button in classic RF Screen and call custom UI and add functionality accordingly as shown in below screenshot.

custom UI should be call when we click on this custom push button "GR + Label print".

by using SAP Screen personas im able to add custom button on this RF classic screen, how do we navigate to the screen sequence designed in FIORI, from this RF application and how do we validate values entered on the custom screen sequence as showns in below screenshot.

Please advise how do we achieve this through which approach, Thanks in advance

---

Deepthi

entry.title: Data Replication Framework - BusinessPartner Replication (S4/HANA Public Cloud to Decentralized EWM)
entry.content:
Hi experts,

I have an issue in which we sent Business Partner master data replication to SAP EWM by using SAP_COM_0008 Communication Scenario with SOAP Service Business Partner - Replicate from SAP S/4HANA Cloud to Client. 

Unfortunately, the SAP EWM side gets the following error: 'No BP role exists for partner 296103'

My EWM Colleague that is working on the SAP EWM system suspects that we get this error because he does not receive BP Role general (000000), whereas he does receive the other roles such as Customer (FLCU01) or Supplier (FLVN01), for example.

I am sure that I am not accidentally filtering BP Role data in the Define Filter Criteria app. Also, SAP EWM side does receive the other roles except for the General (000000) one.

How can this be solved?

entry.title: How to connect from SAP Public cloud(Odata) to SAP MES or other kind of MES System?
entry.content:
Can we connect from Odata from SAP Public Cloud to SAP MES System (or any kind of MES system). 

In SAP MES, MII has JCO Connector, from which we can call RFCs, and I am aware of it.

But how can we connect to Odata to MES? 

Thank you.

entry.title: TDS provisioning
entry.content:
Hello SAP community,

We are currently facing an issue while executing the end-to-end process for maintaining TDS provisions on service accruals through to final payment

To illustrate the scenario, let's assume that we posted an accrual of ₹60000 based on the annual services agreed for a particular service. The WHT tax type we're using is 194J @ 10% which is already maintained in the supplier master data. We also ensured to use invoice based WHT tax types/codes in this case.

  1.  Given the above scenario, we issue a SES at year end amounting to ₹60000
  2.  Now we enter the TDS provision in the app: 'Enter provisions - India' with reference to the purchasing document we created.  JE generated will be: -
    TDS provision A/C..Dr.6000 
    To Withholding tax A/C 6000
  3.  Moving on the next financial year, we post the supplier invoice against the purchasing document that we created earlier.
    GR/IR A/C..Dr60000 
    To Vendor A/C 54000
    To Withholding tax A/C 6000
  4.  Now we utilize the March provision that we posted earlier via the application: 'Utilize provisions-India' 
    Withholding Tax A/C…Dr.6001 
    To TDS provision A/C 6001
  5. We then proceed to reverse the provision that we created via the app: Utilize provision documents - India. 
    TDS provision A/C…Dr.-6000 
    Withholding Tax A/C -6000
  6.  We finally proceed to make the TDS payment in the app: ‘Create remittance challan’, thus completing the process. 

However, we're unable to issue the remittance challan due to the following issue: -

Also, we’re unsure about the extra ₹1 showing up in Step 4 — how did the amount become ₹6001 instead of ₹6000?

Any guidance or clarification regarding these would be greatly appreciated.

  • The discrepancy in the ₹1 difference

  • The remittance challan issue.

Thank you.

Best regards,

Rishav.

entry.title: WM Inbound flow with 2 storage locations and 2 storage bins
entry.content:
Hello,

For my customer, I created 2 WM Storage Locations.

For Inbound flow, one product can be delivered on the 2 Storage Locations.

In the Purchase Order, the requested Storage Location is indicated.

I created 2 Storage Bins to manage the goods receipt  FLIX-GR-AREA and FOX-GR-AREA and depending on the Storage Location indicated in the Purchase Order.

I would like to know what is the relevant customizing to have the correct Storage Location when I create the Inbound Delivery.

 

Can you help ?

entry.title: How to Post Exchange Rate Differences to P&L Instead of Inventory in Purchase Orders
entry.content:
Dear community,

I’m working on a case in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud involving foreign currency valuation in purchase orders.

Here's the scenario:

  • A purchase order is created in USD.
  • At the time of goods receipt (MIGO), the exchange rate is 1.1 EUR/USD.
  • Later, when the invoice is posted, the exchange rate has changed to 1.2 EUR/USD.

    SAP automatically posts the exchange rate difference, but this difference is currently being added to the inventory value — increasing the purchase cost of the material.

    What I need is for this exchange rate difference to be posted to a profit and loss account (e.g., exchange rate gain/loss), not to inventory.

    Is there a way to configure this behavior in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud? Perhaps through account determination, valuation classes, or SSCUI settings?

    Any guidance or documentation would be greatly appreciated.

    Thanks in advance!

entry.title: S4HPC Allergen information
entry.content:
Does sap S4HPC has functionality to handle the allergen material during put away in WM cloud. e.g. Business need to put away the material which has peanut and not to put away any other allergen material underneath it ( e.g. Soy)  Soy can go above the peanuts.

below functionality from on-premise https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_EXTENDED_WAREHOUSE_MANAGEMENT_INDUSTRY_ADD-ON_FOR_SAP_S4HANA/db74c75cb31f4cfa9ce951030222da7b/b94a1d5549224c6d9ec8b2c5058eff48.html 

You can use this process in warehouses dealing with allergen materials where the storage restrictions are considered during put-away. You can check and filter storage bins during put-away of allergen products for multiple allergen classes. For each possible put-away bin, the neighboring bins are checked during put-away.

entry.title: 2025 Update: Alternatives to Scope Item 2JD (Fiori Analytical Apps for Production Planning)
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

In the recent 2025 release of SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, I noticed that the scope item 2JD (SAP Fiori Analytical Apps for Production Planning) has been removed.

My question is:
 What functions, apps, or tools within the system will replace the analytical capabilities previously provided by this scope item?
Are these functionalities now integrated into standard SAP Fiori apps, Embedded Analytics, or perhaps another specific scope item?

Any guidance or reference would be highly appreciated.

Thanks in advance!

entry.title: CBC Baseline Scopes vs. Manual Selection – What’s the Best Practice?
entry.content:
Hello Community,

We are currently running an SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition (version 2508, Colombia localization) implementation project and have encountered the following situation:

  • During the configuration in Central Business Configuration (CBC), we advanced through the Fit-to-Standard workshops and proceeded to load the Finance scope items.

  • Upon validation, we noticed that some scope items selected in the DDA are no activated (e.g., 1GB, 1GF, 33M, 3M4, BGC) we find out that they were retired or absorbed into other processes.

  • When trying to load the scopes through a JSON file, the full Baseline gets re-activated. This includes scope items that are not needed for our specific business case.

Our questions are:

  1. Is it necessary or mandatory to always work with the full Baseline in implementation projects, even if it contains scope items that do not apply to the customer?

  2. What is the recommended approach in such cases?

    • Proceed with the Baseline including the “extra” scopes?

    • Or manually select only the scope items strictly required for the business?

  3. What is the best practice to avoid inconsistencies in CBC when loading/adjusting scopes via JSON, considering that this automatically re-activates the baseline?

We would greatly appreciate guidance from the community (or SAP directly) on the recommended way forward in these scenarios, as we want to ensure the configuration complies with the standard and avoids rework later on.

Thank you in advance!

entry.title: Baseline scope items activation – how to prevent unwanted items
entry.content:
We are currently activating the required scope items for our project, but several scope items that we have already identified as not to be implemented are also being activated. Some of them, such as 1MC and 2LH, seem to be part of the baseline.

Is it possible to prevent these scope items from being activated, or does the baseline always need to remain fully active?

entry.title: Scope items included in DDA but not available in CBC – Guidance needed (S/4HANA Cloud Public 2508)
entry.content:
Hello Community,

We are currently working on an SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition (release 2508, Colombia localization) project and have encountered an issue related to scope items availability:

During our Fit-to-Standard workshops and the Digital Discovery Assessment (DDA), the following scope items were included in our functional package:

  • 1GB – Asset Accounting with Group Ledger (IFRS)

  • 1GF – Assets Under Construction with Group Ledger (IFRS)

  • 33M – Revenue Recognition – Sell from Stock (IFRS)

  • 3M4 – Revenue Recognition – Service Documents (IFRS)

  • BGC – Fiori Analytical Apps for General Ledger

  • 2JB – SAP Fiori Analytical Apps for Financial Accounting

  • 1GI – General Ledger Allocation Cycle

However, when moving forward with the configuration in Central Business Configuration (CBC) and in Signavio Process Navigator, we noticed that these scope items are not available for selection.

This raises uncertainty on how to proceed, and we would like to ask the community for guidance:

  1. Have these scope items been officially retired in release 2508, and are their capabilities already integrated into other scope items (e.g., Universal Parallel Accounting, Universal Allocation, or Fiori analytical catalogs)?

  2. Is there any alternative procedure to enable them in CBC?

  3. If they have been replaced, what are the successor scope items or the best practice recommended to cover these functionalities in the project?

Our main goal is to ensure that the scope defined in DDA is properly reflected in CBC, without leaving functional gaps or including obsolete scope items.

Any guidance from the community (or SAP experts) on the best way forward would be greatly appreciated.

Thank you in advance!

entry.title: API for Creating Product Characteristics on S4HC Public Edition.
entry.content:
Hi Practitioners,

Is there any API available on S4 Hana Public cloud out of the box to create Product Characteristics and assign the values. The Product Master (A2X) API does not have any possible way to create Classification Data for holding the Product Characteristic values.
The API Product Master Data Including Classification – Read does not have Create option and it is limited to Read.
Please suggest any API for creating the characteristic data for a product. 

Regards,
Shyam Prasad

entry.title: How to Add Text IDs for Customer Master (KNA1) in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition?
entry.content:
In SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, I would like to add a new Text ID for the Customer Master (KNA1) via CBC.

However, I can only find the configuration activity “Define Text Types for Sales Area Texts in Customer Master(SSCUI: 105683)” (which is related to KNVV). I cannot find any configuration option to add or maintain Text IDs for KNA1.

Does anyone know if it is possible to add Text IDs for KNA1 in S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, and if so, how this can be done?

entry.title: S4HC Public Cloud Eclipse created CDS and AMDP
entry.content:
Hi 

we have a S/4 HANA PUBLIC CLOUD.  I am trying to understand AMDP.  Have followed this blog Understanding CDS Table Functions | by SATYASRI AKULA | SAP Innovation Hub | Medium and exactly followed the instructions .

In Eclipse the provided CDS Table Function has activated

but the AMDP class on the line FOR TABLE FUNCTION Z_JOURNAL_DATA

has a syntax error The method "GET_JE_DATA" implements the CDS table function "Z_JOURNAL_DATA". The client handling annotation for "Z_JOURNAL_DATA" is incomplete or wrong in the current language version.

I tried to fix it by including the annotations as below but I still get that same error.  Why ?

CDS table function - this activated ok

@EndUserText.label: 'Journal Data'
@AccessControl.authorizationCheck: #NOT_REQUIRED // No auth checks (default)
@ClientHandling.algorithm: #SESSION_VARIABLE //the client_element_name column is filled from the session client (sy-mandt).
@ClientHandling.type: #CLIENT_DEPENDENT //artifact ignores clients (like cross-client customizing tables in ABAP).

define table function Z_JOURNAL_DATA
with parameters @Environment.systemField: #CLIENT
     i_rclnt   : mandt,
     i_RBUKRS  : bukrs, 
     i_GJAHR   : gjahr 
    
returns {
    rclnt :mandt;
    RLDNR : fins_ledger; 
    RBUKRS: bukrs; 
    GJAHR : gjahr; 
    BELNR : belnr_d; 
  
}

implemented by method zcl_acc_je_dat=>GET_JE_DATA;

ADMP Class  - it errors on the FOR TABLE FUNCTION Z_JOURNAL_DATA.

CLASS zcl_acc_je_dat DEFINITION PUBLIC.
PUBLIC SECTION.

TYPES: BEGIN OF ty_je,
        rclnt  TYPE mandt,
        rldnr  TYPE FINS_LEDGER,
        rbukrs TYPE bukrs,
        gjahr  TYPE gjahr,
        belnr  TYPE belnr_d,
        rhcur  TYPE FINS_CURRH,
        END   OF ty_je,
       tt_acc_data TYPE TABLE OF ty_je.

  DATA: lv_where TYPE  string,
        lv_fin   TYPE  tt_acc_data ,
        lt_filter TYPE tt_acc_data.


INTERFACES if_amdp_marker_hdb.
    CLASS-METHODS  GET_JE_DATA 
 FOR TABLE FUNCTION Z_JOURNAL_DATA.

ENDCLASS.

CLASS zcl_acc_je_dat IMPLEMENTATION.
METHOD GET_JE_DATA BY DATABASE FUNCTION FOR HDB LANGUAGE SQLSCRIPT OPTIONS READ-ONLY USING ACDOCA.

       return SELECT rclnt, rldnr, rbukrs, gjahr, belnr, rhcur FROM acdoca
      WHERE rclnt =  :i_rclnt
        AND rbukrs = :i_rbukrs
        AND gjahr =  :i_gjahr;

ENDMETHOD.
ENDCLASS.
